MultipleChoice.Title: Money
MultipleChoice.Instruction: Click on the word or phrase with the same meaning as the expressions in italics.

Content.Question:
1. The shoes from that shop are very expensive but it’s worth paying the money, because the shoes are really chic. priceless
pricey
valueless

2. We were advised to decide who we want to have our possessions and money when we die. So we wrote out
... a document outlining who we wanted to have what. a prenuptial agreement
damages
a will

3. Jodie is not generous with money. She doesn’t like lending money to people and is always complaining about
... having to spend money! tight-fisted
broke
bankrupt

4. We put down some money on the house to secure it as soon as we saw it. It was a fabulous house! credit cards
coins
a deposit

5. When Giles and Jean returned from their holiday, they had no money at all. were broke
were broken
were bankrupt

6. If I bought that sports car, I would not be able to pay the monthly loan repayments and my bank account
... would be overdrawn.in the black
in the green
in the red

7. This year has been so difficult for getting business, we’ll be lucky if we don’t lose any money and don’t make a
... profit.break up
break into
break even

8. Two or three politicians were suspected of accepting money in return for agreeing to do certain things.taking a bribe
taking a subsidy
taking a fee

9. Jane can be quite mean when it comes to giving money to charity or sponsoring people who are raising money
... for charity. shattered
stingy
broke

10. Andrew’s business finally closed down when he was no longer able to repay his debts and he had to sell off his
..... property and goods.went bankrupt
broke even
went in the red
